meanings.definition: A type of firearm operated by a burning match
meanings.sent1: The matchlock was used by soldiers in ancient battles.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an old matchlock from the 16th century.
meanings.sent3: The pirate captain proudly showed off his shiny matchlock to his crew.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a matchlock, ready to fire at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the matchlock echoed through the valley, signaling the start of the battle.

meanings.sent1: He carefully aimed before he could matchlock the weapon.
meanings.sent2: The soldier had to matchlock quickly to defend his position.
meanings.sent3: She tried to matchlock the gun, but the match kept going out.
meanings.sent4: The sparks flew as he tried to matchlock the ancient firearm.
meanings.sent5: With a steady hand, he prepared to matchlock the match to fire the gun.
